He has his own combine harvester and drier,essential with the big drop in many grain prices-cutting by a contractor would cost Â£20-30 per acre and he has 388 acres to cut.The farm has grown by buying up small farms which do not pay and this has meant the changing of some field boundaries, but he likes to keep existing hedges wherever possible.The optimum size of field is 15-20 acres. He buys week-old calves and sells them direct to the abattoir for beef at 18-24 months.Most of the cattle are Hereford/Friesian cross,though he will buy others if the price is right.Nearly all are steers fed on grass.He administers his own drugs
